* Represents the user interface for YNCH chatbot.
* Constructs a YnchUi object with the default name "YNCH".
* Prints a message when a task is added to the task list.
* @param size the current size of the task list
System.out.println("Meow! I've added this task: \n" + task +
"\n Now you have " + size + " tasks in the list.");
* Prints a message when a task is deleted from the task list.
* @param size the current size of the task list
System.out.println("Meow! I've removed this task: \n" + task +
"\n Now you have " + size + " tasks in the list.");
* Prints a message when a task is marked as done.
System.out.println("Meow! I've marked this task as done: \n" + task);
* Prints a message when a task is unmarked as not done.
System.out.println("Meow! I've marked this task as not done yet: \n" + task);
System.out.println("Meow! I can't find anything matching your search :(");
System.out.println("Meow! Here are the matching tasks in your list: \n" + tasks.list());
System.out.println("Meow! I'm YNCH. What can I do for you?");
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon meow!");
* Loads and saves tasks into a file
// Initialize the Storage object with a test file path
// Clean up the test file after each test
assertTrue(taskList.getTasks().isEmpty(), "Task list should be empty when loading from an empty file");
// Create a TaskList and save it
taskListToSave.add(new Todo(0, "Test Todo")); // Assuming Todo constructor takes (status, description)
// Load the tasks from the file
assertEquals(1, loadedTaskList.getTasks().size(), "Task list should contain one task after loading");
assertEquals("Test Todo", loadedTaskList.getTasks().get(0).getDescription(), "Loaded task description should match");
assertTrue(task instanceof Todo, "Task should be an instance of Todo");
assertEquals("Test Todo", task.getDescription(), "Task description should match");
assertTrue(task instanceof Deadline, "Task should be an instance of Deadline");
assertEquals("Deadline Task", task.getDescription(), "Deadline task description should match");
assertTrue(task instanceof Event, "Task should be an instance of Event");
assertEquals("Event Task", task.getDescription(), "Event task description should match");
assertFalse(task.isDone, "Task should not be done initially");
assertTrue(task.isDone, "Task should be marked as done");
// Test the stringToDate method with valid date strings

assertNull(date, "Date should be null for an invalid string");
